title.native: 結城友奈は勇者である -勇者の章-
title.romaji: Yuuki Yuuna wa Yuusha de Aru: Yuusha no Shou
title.english: Yuki Yuna is a Hero: The Hero Chapter

description:
The second season of Yuuki Yuuna wa Yuusha de Aru.

Having fulfilled their destiny during the events of Yuuki Yuuna wa Yuusha de Aru, Sanshu Middle School's Hero Club—consisting of Yuuna Yuuki, Karin Miyoshi, and siblings Fuu and Itsuki Inubouzaki—is back in full swing, helping out those in need wherever they can. They have also gained a new member, a hero from the past named Sonoko Nogi. But eventually they notice that someone who should be among them, Mimori Tougou, is missing; any trace of her existence is completely gone, save for the girls' memories.

With no leads on Tougou's whereabouts, the girls regain the ability to transform and begin the desperate search for their lost friend. But what they find is more shocking than any of them could ever have imagined, and the consequences of their actions begin to change life as they know it.

(Source: MAL Rewrite)

tags.description: Main cast is mostly composed of female characters.

tags.description: Centers on the belief that humanity is related to supernatural, transcendental, and spiritual elements.

tags.name: Spearplay

tags.description: Prominently features a character who acts cold and hostile in order to mask warmer emotions.

tags.name: Post-Apocalyptic

tags.name: Cute Girls Doing Cute Things
tags.description: Centers around female characters doing cute activities, usually with little to no emphasis on drama and conflict.

tags.name: Primarily Child Cast
tags.description: Main cast is mostly composed of characters below a high school age.

tags.name: Tragedy
tags.description: Centers around tragic events and unhappy endings.

tags.name: Coastal
tags.description: Story prominently takes place near the beach or around a coastal area/town. Setting is near the ocean.

tags.name: CGI
tags.description: Prominently features scenes created with computer-generated imagery.

node.description:
[Twitter](https://twitter.com/i/user/995498317)

Interested in films and comics from his early childhood on. After graduating high school he went to Yoyogi Animation Gakuin and afterwards started working as animator for [Ajia-do](https://anilist.co/studio/30/). After becoming a freelancer for a short time, he joined Logistics where he worked in the software development section and was responsible for animation work and later developing tools for animation work in games. In 2002 he founded [Team Till Dawn](https://anilist.co/studio/6412/), which was also the beginning of his career as anime director.

His hobbies outside of work include bodybuilding, in which he has gone as far as to take part in competitions
[Twitter](https://twitter.com/uezux) | [Website](http://uezu.soregashi.com/)

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/daiki_fukuoka)

**Daiki Fukuoka** is a Japanese director, episode director, production manager and storyboard artist.

__[Profile (MONACA)](https://monaca.jp/member/okabe)__ | __[Twitter](https://twitter.com/MONACA_okabe)__

__Keiichi Okabe__ is a Japanese vocalist, composer and arranger, who is particularly known for composing soundtracks for game producers Square Enix and Bandai Namco, which include various soundtracks for the Nier, Drakengard, and Tekken series. He is also the founder and CEO of music and sound production studio, MONACA.

[Official website](http://bunplusbun.sakura.ne.jp/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/bunbun922) | [Blog (abec)](http://abec.blog93.fc2.com/) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/bunbun_plus) | [Pixiv](https://www.pixiv.net/users/8142) | [Youtube](https://www.youtube.com/c/BUNBUN922)

His older sister is [Yukiko Horiguchi](https://anilist.co/staff/102497/Yukiko-Horiguchi).

Major illustration works: 
- Kare Kanojo and Summon Magic (カレとカノジョと召喚魔法)
- Mary Rose (薔薇のマリア) - We AI (僕らA.I) 
- Shinkyoku Soukai Polyphonica Black Series (神曲奏界ポリフォニカ ブラック・シリーズ) 
- Girl with Radio Jamming (ラジオガール・ウィズ・ジャミング) 
- Zoahanta (ゾアハンター) (with Junichi Osako, author of Polyphonica Black) 
- Asuka 
- Garouden Mahjon - (アスカ -麻雀餓狼伝-) 
- All Death War (全死大戦)  

Other works: 
- Illustrations BUNBUN (illustration collection) 
- Rondo of Swords (DS game - character designs) 
- Shinkyoku Soukai Polyphonia THE BLACK (PC Game / Kinetic Novel - character designs).

[Website](http://kanatanakamura.com/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/kanata_nakamura?s=09) 

She used to study abroad in France during her high school days. Graduated from Seijo University, Department of Literature.

Debuted in 2009 as Lyricist "KANATA". She is affiliated with [APDREAM](http://apdream.co.jp/)

__Agency:__ Hibiki

[Website](http://mimorin.com/) | [Profile (Hibiki Cast)](https://hibiki-cast.jp/hibiki_f/mimori_suzuko/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/mimori_suzuko)  | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/mimorin.official/) | [LINE Blog](https://lineblog.me/mimori_suzuko/)

**Non anime roles:**
- Sangonomiya Kokomi - Genshin Impact (VG)
- Match - Kirara Fantasia (VG)
- Pinkie Pie - My Little Pony Friendship is Magic (Japanese dub)
- Rapunzel - Goddess of Victory: Nikke (VG)

__[Profile (MONACA)](https://monaca.jp/member/okabe)__ | __[Twitter](https://twitter.com/MONACA_okabe)__

__Keiichi Okabe__ is a Japanese vocalist, composer and arranger, who is particularly known for composing soundtracks for game producers Square Enix and Bandai Namco, which include various soundtracks for the Nier, Drakengard, and Tekken series. He is also the founder and CEO of music and sound production studio, MONACA.

__Height:__ 156 cm (5'1")

[Profile](https://osawa-inc.co.jp/women/hanazawakana/) | [Website](http://www.hanazawakana-music.net/) | [Website 2](http://www.hanazawakana-music.net/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/hanazawa_staff) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/hanazawa_kana.official/)  | [YouTube]( https://www.youtube.com/@hanazawa_kana/) | [Radio page](https://www.joqr.co.jp/qr/program/dekirukana/) | [TikTok](https://www.tiktok.com/@hanazawa_kana.official)

__Introduction__
Kana Hanazawa is a voice actress, actress, singer, former child actress, and talent represented by Office Osawa. In July 2020, she married fellow voice actor [Kensho Ono](https://anilist.co/staff/95819), whom she had been dating since 2017. 

__Early Career__
Hanazawa originally became a child actress at the age of 8. Amongst other roles, she starred in the well-known TV school show _Appare Sanma Daisensei_ and the TV series _Gakkou no Sensei_. At that time she was contracted to Big Apple, and later to Five Eight and Smile Monkey.

__Voice Acting Career__
At the age of 14, she made her voice acting debut in 2003 as Holly in _[Last Exile](https://anilist.co/anime/97/)_. Three years later in 2006, she was selected for a major role in TV Tokyo's anime mecha series _[Zegapain](https://anilist.co/anime/878/)_. She was playing the main character's childhood friend, [Kaminagi Ryouko](https://anilist.co/character/2578/), and her performance was one of the main reasons for the character's popularity amongst fans. It was afterwards that she came under contract at prestigious voice acting talent agency Office Osawa in 2007.

Hanazawa went to university in 2007, while at the same time, she began to make her mark as a voice actress. She was voted in 2010 as "Best Female Voice Actress" by listeners of the radio program Nonko and Nobita's Anime Scramble. She graduated from university in 2011, and in the same year became a full-time voice actress.

Hanazawa won Best Supporting Actress at the 9th Seiyuu Awards for her role as [Kosaki Onodera](https://anilist.co/character/52723/) in _[Nisekoi](https://anilist.co/anime/18897/)_. She also won Newtype's Best Voice Actress award in 2015 and later in 2018.

__Music Career__
On February 23, 2012, it was announced that Hanazawa would launch her official website. A few days later, during the Kana Hanazawa Solo Debut Presentation Party event, it was announced that she would release four singles within a year: "Hoshizora Destination" on April 25, "Hatsukoi no Oto" released on July 18, "Happy Endings" on October 24 (an ending theme for _[Zetsuen no Tempest](https://anilist.co/anime/14075/)_), and "Silent Snow" on January 16, 2013. Her first album Claire was released on February 20, 2013, and her second album 25 was released on February 26, 2014. She released an album title Blue Avenue in April 2015 and went on a concert tour starting at the Nippon Budokan on May 3. The Blu-ray release of the show, Live Avenue Kana Hanazawa in Budokan, ranked number six in sales.

__Trivia__
- She was invited to Anime Festival Asia 2010 on stage.
- She used to be a junior idol in Akihabara where hundreds of people came to watch her, which is how she got her breakthrough for her acting career in commercials before becoming a voice actress.

**Non-anime roles:**
- [Marie](https://anilist.co/character/89069/Marie) - Persona 4 Golden (VG)
- Hakari Atsuko - Blue Archive (VG)
- Illya - Memento Mori (VG)
- Marian - Goddess of Victory: Nikke (VG)
- Modernia - Goddess of Victory: Nikke (VG)
- Alice Kuonji (Caster) - Fate/Grand Order (VG)

[Profile (MONACA)](http://www.monaca.jp/staff/takahashi.html)

Japanese composer and arranger working for music production company MONACA since 2013. He is a graduate of Hokkaido University of Education.

[Agency Profile](https://www.aoni.co.jp/search/terui-haruka.html)

She married the 7-dan go player Tomoya Hirata on March 3rd, 2021.

__Agency:__ Mausu Promotion (2012-2021), Toho Entertainment (2021-)

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/TomoyoKurosawa) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/tomoyo_kurosawa_official_/) | [Blog](http://ameblo.jp/kurosawa-tomoyo/)

A Japanese actress, voice actress, and singer. Kurosawa began studying acting at the age of 3. In 2000, she began appearing in TV dramas, commercials and stage performances. At the age of 13, she made her voice acting debut as [Natsuki Koyama](https://anilist.co/character/30214/) in the 2010 anime film [Welcome to the Space Show](https://anilist.co/anime/8115/).

Kurosawa became a support member of Sound Horizon in 2008.

On June 8, 2023, her agency announced her marriage on Twitter.

__Awards:__
- Best Lead Actress at the 12th Seiyuu Awards in 2018 for her roles as [Phosphophyllite](https://anilist.co/character/123385/) and [Kumiko Oumae](https://anilist.co/character/88708/).

(Source: Wikipedia)

[Profile](https://osawa-inc.co.jp/women/uchiyamayumi/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/yuumin_uchiyama)

On January 1st, 2025, it was announced that she had gotten married to voice actor [Yuusuke Kobayashi](https://anilist.co/staff/118407).

__Non-Anime Roles:__
• Tera Isezaki in "Marco & The Galaxy Dragon" (VG) (Japanese)
• Natasha in "Honkai: Star Rail" (VG) (Japanese)

__[Profile (MONACA)](https://monaca.jp/member/okabe)__ | __[Twitter](https://twitter.com/MONACA_okabe)__

__Keiichi Okabe__ is a Japanese vocalist, composer and arranger, who is particularly known for composing soundtracks for game producers Square Enix and Bandai Namco, which include various soundtracks for the Nier, Drakengard, and Tekken series. He is also the founder and CEO of music and sound production studio, MONACA.

__Hobby:__ Painting

[Website](http://zero-a.jp/special/nagatsumajuri/) | [Profile](http://www.pro-fit.co.jp/talent_nagatuma.html) | [Blog](https://ameblo.jp/wife812-juri/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/nagatsumajuri)

He founded the adult game brand [Minato Soft](http://minatosoft.com/t4p/) in 2006.

Japanese composer and arranger working for music production company MONACA since 2013. He is a graduate of Hokkaido University of Education.

[Website](https://monaca.jp/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/MONACA_jp)

__MONACA__ is a Japanese music production studio, which was established by the composer Keiichi Okabe in October 2004.

__Members__:

• [Satoru Kousaki](https://anilist.co/staff/101555/Satoru-Kousaki)

__Past Members__:

• [Keigo Hoashi](https://anilist.co/staff/111233/Keigo-Hoashi)

[Twitter](https://x.com/KeigoHoashi)

Keigo Hoashi is a composer and arranger, and a pianist. He was formerly part of the unit [MONACA](https://anilist.co/staff/110481/MONACA).
